unnormalised: The email pinged just as I was finishing my chai, another Monday morning at the office. "Urgent: All staff to attend meeting, 10:00 AM sharp." Signed, "Mr. Sharma, HR." I sighed. Mr. Sharma, bless his soul, was a stickler for punctuality, a quality I sometimes struggled with, especially after a late-night Bollywood movie.

unnormalised: Mr. Sharma cleared his throat, the universal signal for silence. "Good morning, everyone. As you know, our company has been growing rapidly. "Effective immediately, Mr. Rajesh Kumar will be promoted to Head of Operations."

unnormalised: A ripple of polite applause. Rajesh, a quiet but incredibly competent individual, deserved the recognition. He'd been putting in long hours, often staying till 9 PM to ensure everything ran smoothly. I remembered him mentioning once how he'd started at the company as a junior clerk, learning everything from the ground up.

unnormalised: Then came the real surprise. "Furthermore," Mr. Sharma continued, "Dr. Anjali Nair will be taking on the role of Chief Innovation Officer." Anjali, whom everyone affectionately called Anju, was known for her quirky ideas and infectious enthusiasm. She had a knack for seeing possibilities where others saw roadblocks, and her promotion was a testament to the company's commitment to fostering creativity. I always admired her and thought that she had the capabilities to excel. She holds a PhD from IIT, Delhi.

unnormalised: The meeting wrapped up with a few more announcements, but the atmosphere had already shifted. There was a buzz of excitement, a sense of renewed purpose. As I left the room, I couldn't help but feel a surge of optimism. Maybe, just maybe, this new structure wouldn't be just another corporate reshuffle. Maybe it would actually make a difference. Plus, now I had an excuse to finally ask Dr. Nair about her recipe for masala chai!
